meanings.definition: Having a definite or well-defined shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle pieces fit together in a formful way.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a formful sculpture out of clay.
meanings.sent3: The formful cake looked almost too perfect to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so formful, it could be mistaken for a font.
meanings.sent5: The formful tree stood tall and proud in the center of the garden.

meanings.definition: Showing or possessing a pleasing or attractive form.
meanings.sent1: The dress had a formful silhouette that flattered her figure.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky in a formful array of colors.
meanings.sent3: The formful bouquet of flowers brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: Her dance movements were so formful, they mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The formful design of the building caught the attention of passersby.
